item.title: Code
item.description: CodeChecker With CodeChecker we created a tool to view and manage the results found by multiple static analyzers like Clang Static Analyzer and Clang Tidy. You can check your C/C++ project easily and filter/view the results on a web interface or in the command line. With the command line interface integration to the Continous Integration loops can be done easily.

item.title: My Hugo setup for GitHub pages
item.description: In this post I will introduce my current Hugo setup. I will show you how I configured the git repositories, how I write new posts and how easy it is to publish the generated site on GitHub pages. With a static site generator like Hugo it is really easy to create a blogging environment where your posts and your site is version controlled and stored in git. Why I've changed my first setup I've tried to use one git repository for the generated site and for the posts in markdown together.

item.title: Hello world!
item.description: Hi, my name is Gyorgy Orban and I work as a software developer. I thougth about starting a technical blog a long time ago and now it's time to start it. My goal with this blog is to organize, archive and share my thoughts. I plan to post about the projects I'm working on or about technologies I find interesting and useful. Stay tuned for my next post!

item.title: About
item.description: Who am I? Hi, I'm Gyorgy Orban and this is my personal blog. I love to create software and I'm a full time software developer. I've worked on multiple telecom related projects over the years. Currently I'm involved in the open source development of the CodeChecker project. I code mostly in Python but I play with other languages too. You can read more about my projects on my code page.
